Package texteditor

Class UnrolledTextList

  • java.lang.Object
    • texteditor.UnrolledTextList
  • public class UnrolledTextList
extends java.lang.Object
    UnrolledTextList represents an mutable Unrolled Linked List which stores text.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UnrolledTextList​(int nodeSize)
      Constructs an empty list with the given node capacity

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clear()
      Clears the list
      UnrolledTextList copyText​(int i, int j)
      Copies the text from ith character to the jth character in the document (exclusive).
      UnrolledTextList cutText​(int i, int j)
      Cuts the text from ith character to jth character in the document (exclusive).
      void insertText​(java.lang.String text)
      Appends the given text into the list, filling each node to the maximum capacity.
      void pasteText​(int i, UnrolledTextList pasteText)
      Pastes the text in the clipboard into the document starting from the ith character.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Converts the list into its text (String) representation.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UnrolledTextList

        public UnrolledTextList​(int nodeSize)
        Constructs an empty list with the given node capacity
        Parameters:
        nodeSize - number of characters per node
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nodeSize is negative

    • Method Detail

      • insertText

        public void insertText​(java.lang.String text)
        Appends the given text into the list, filling each node to the maximum capacity.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be inserted into the list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if text is null

      • copyText

        public UnrolledTextList copyText​(int i,
                                 int j)
        Copies the text from ith character to the jth character in the document (exclusive). If the ending index is greater than the length of the document (in terms of characters), then the copied text ranges from starting index to the end of the document.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the starting character that needs to be copied
        j - the index of the ending character that needs to be copied
        Returns:
        A UnrolledTextList containing the copied text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if j < i or i < 0 or i > document length (in characters)

      • cutText

        public UnrolledTextList cutText​(int i,
                                int j)
        Cuts the text from ith character to jth character in the document (exclusive). If the ending index is greater than the length of the document (in terms of characters), then the cut text ranges from starting index to the end of the document.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the starting character that needs to be copied
        j - the index of the ending character that needs to be copied
        Returns:
        A UnrolledTextList containing the cut text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if j < i or i < 0 or i > document length (in characters)

      • pasteText

        public void pasteText​(int i,
                      UnrolledTextList pasteText)
        Pastes the text in the clipboard into the document starting from the ith character.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the starting character in the document
        pasteText - unrolled text list in the clipboard
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if i > document length or clipboard is null

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the list

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts the list into its text (String) representation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representing the text in the list
